content: I've added a user login block to my home page, but I'm struggling to add a user registration form into a page that I can customise - i.e. as a block within a view.

@Kevin Golding Sounds like you might need this: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/formblock

backdrop-contrib/formblock
Enables the presentation of user registration, site wide contact, or node creation forms in blocks. - backdrop-contrib/formblock
@BWPanda :congratulations: That's exactly what I needed - thank you :)
I'm trying to use a custom layout for the /user/** paths, but they always seem to use the default layout. I've tried setting my layout path to user user/% & user/%/% to no avail.
Looks like I need to do the reverse, and use my custom layout specifically for nodes, and leave the default layout alone.
It didn't seem too, also an emailed reset link didn't work.

@Kevin Golding I may be asking a dumb question, but did you set the condition on the custom layout path to only show user info?

For example, setting node/% still uses the default layout until I set a condition for the content types that will use the custom layout.

Disclaimer: I'm new to BD also, so anyone who has more experienced is welcome to correct me.

@Kevin Golding I just tested this and I noticed that I needed to enter a Layout name and select a template first, then I could enter user/% and it automatically created the appropriate context: image.png
The caveat I think is that this won't work for login and registration pages. Only user accounts

@Phil Ward @BWPanda Thanks for the pointers, I've settled on using the default layout and am using node/% for my custom layout, and I'll clone it for tags/%'s etc as needed. I think I was trying to be too clever overriding the default layout :)

Could this be related to https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4029
